meanings.definition: The study of the geographic distribution of plants.
meanings.sent1: In phytogeographies, scientists map where different plants grow around the world.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use phytogeographies to understand why certain plants thrive in specific regions.
meanings.sent3: The phytogeographies class took a field trip to explore plant locations in the city park.
meanings.sent4: Her book on phytogeographies painted a vivid picture of plant habitats across continents.
meanings.sent5: Through phytogeographies, we can visualize the botanical diversity of our planet.

meanings.definition: The branch of science that deals with the geographical distribution of plant life.
meanings.sent1: Phytogeographies help us learn how plants are spread across different environments.
meanings.sent2: Botanists rely on phytogeographies to study the patterns of plant distribution.
meanings.sent3: During the phytogeographies conference, experts discussed plant migration in a fun way.
meanings.sent4: The concept of phytogeographies sheds light on the interconnectedness of plant ecosystems.
meanings.sent5: Exploring phytogeographies opens a window into the world of plant geography.
